descriptionHtml:
[font=Courier New][color=#ff0000][size=5][u][b]Ilinalta Hideout
[/b][/u][/size][/color][/font][color=#ffffff][size=3]Ilinalta Hideout is a small player home located between the Halfmoon-Mill and the Guardian Stones. It´s a house with custom storage and all crafting stations, meant for a mage but it can be used with every other character as well (except for a character who wants sloots. Sloots are unimmersive and therefor not in this mod. Sorry ;D). The house also has a garden and some shrines. However you can´t move in there with your family because...do I need to have a reason for that? Well because there´s not enough space.

If you want your home to look like in the pictures you´ll have to use the Tetrachromatic ENB, Verdant and The Skyrim Flora Overhaul

[/size][/color][font=Courier New][color=#ff0000][size=3][b][u]Features
[/u][/b][/size][/color][/font][color=#ffffff][size=3]-Custom Storage for: Helmets, Armors, Gauntlets, Boots, Clothes, Robes, Scrolls, Books, Spell Books, Weapons, Shields, Ingredients, Potions and Miscellaneous Items
-All crafting stations (except for the smelter) can be found in- and outside the house
-Custom Enchanting Table
-Custom sword and doll
-Lots of detail and clutter
-Garden and flowerpots with many ingridients
-Nice location at Lake Ilinalta

[/size][/color][font=Courier New][color=#ff0000][size=3][b][u]How to get the home
[/u][/b][/size][/color][/font][color=#ffffff][size=3]To obtain the home just go to it (found between Halfmoon-Mill and the Guardian Stones) and kill the guardian in front of it. Loot his body and you´ll get the key to the house.

[/size][/color][font=Courier New][color=#ff0000][size=3][b][u]Questions and Suggestions
[/u][/b][/size][/color][/font][color=#ffffff][size=3]If you have any questions or suggestions please let me know.

[/size][/color][font=Courier New][color=#ff0000][size=3][b][u]Thank you
[/u][/b][/size][/color][/font][color=#ffffff][size=3]If you´re using the mod, I want to thank you. This is my first mod and I hope you´ll like it :D[/size][/color]
author: Schlammbrot
